home.title: About District
home.body: Ayodhya, also known as Oudh or Awadh, is a town in northern India's Uttar Pradesh state. It is located east of Faizabad on the Ghaghara River.

a.title: Before appraise of time
a.body: A massive but short-lived structure of almost 50m north–south direction was built during the early mediaeval period (11–12th century CE).

b.title: Masjid-i Janmasthan
b.body: It was built by Mir Baqi, possibly a bey serving under Mughal emperor Babur, in the year 935 of the Islamic calendar (Sep 1528–Sep 1529 CE).

c.title: Demolition of the Babri Masjid
c.body: On Dec 6, 1992, a group of activists from the Vishva Hindu Parishad and other organisations demolished the Babri Masjid illegally.

d.title: Shri Ram Mandir Ayodhya
d.body: The temple construction is being supervised by the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra. Architect: Chandrakant Sompura
